questions.question: Granny’s plane ……………………….. at three o’clock.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about events which are part of a timetable.

questions.question: The next semester …………………………. on November 10th.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about events which are part of a timetable.

questions.question: I will pay you back when I ………………… a job.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the future tense, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to the future.

questions.question: I will call you when dinner ………………………… ready.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the future tense, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to the future.

questions.question: Rani ………………………….. for a drink.
questions.description: The present continuous is often used to talk about future events when the arrangement already exists.

questions.question: ‘The phone is ringing.’ ‘I …………………… it.’
questions.description: We use the simple future to announce decisions taken at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: I ………………………….. the tickets but you have to buy the dinner.
questions.description: We use the simple future tense to talk about our decisions and intentions.

questions.question: I think I ……………………….. it.
questions.description: We do not use the simple present or present continuous to announce decisions that are made at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: ………………………… I open a window?
questions.description: We use shall in questions asking for instructions and decisions.

questions.question: Let’s go and see her, …………………………. we?
questions.description: We use shall in question tags after let.

questions.question: …………………………… you get me some apples when you’re out?
questions.description: We use will to ask people to do things.

questions.question: Get me a cup of coffee, ………………………… you?
